Headline.Para: UK PRESS: Iran Has Set Up Spy Ops In S Lebanon - Israel

LeadPara.Para: LONDON (Dow Jones)--Iran has set up a sophisticated intelligence gathering operation in southern Lebanon to identify targets in northern Israel in the event of a military confrontation over its controversial nuclear program, The Daily Telegraph reports Tuesday.

Senior Israeli military commanders say Iran has spent tens of millions of pounds helping its close ally, Hezbollah, the Shia Muslim militant group that controls southern Lebanon, set up a network of control towers and monitoring stations along the entire length of Israel's border with south Lebanon.

TailParas.Para: This is now Iran's front line with Israel," a senior Israeli military commander said. "The Iranians are using Hezbollah to spy on us so that they can collect information for future attacks. And there is very little we can do about it."
